models.insights: AI-generated recommendations, alerts, or analysis about spending patterns, tax optimization opportunities, deductions, subsidies, or financial trends.
models.rules: User-defined or AI-generated categorization rules with conditions, automatically applied to new transactions for consistent categorization.

relationships: Each Insight is generated by analyzing transaction patterns, budget deviations, or identifying opportunities
Each Insight may link to related transactions or accounts that triggered the recommendation
Each Rule defines conditions and actions for automatic transaction categorization
AI-generated Rules appear as Insights for user approval before activation

insights.title: Unclaimed Home Office Deduction
insights.description: Based on your workspace expenses and work patterns, you may qualify for a home office deduction of up to $1,500 annually. This includes utilities, internet, and a portion of rent allocated to your dedicated workspace.

insights.title: Eligible for Small Business Energy Credit
insights.description: Your business qualifies for the federal Small Business Energy Efficiency Credit. Based on your recent equipment purchases, you could claim up to $2,800 in tax credits for energy-efficient upgrades.

insights.title: Software Subscription Optimization
insights.description: You're paying for 3 overlapping software subscriptions with similar features. Consolidating to a single platform could save you $150/month while maintaining the same functionality.

insights.title: Detected Pattern: AWS Charges
insights.description: I've noticed recurring AWS charges from Amazon Web Services. Should I automatically categorize these as 'Software & Tools' going forward?

insights.title: Vehicle Mileage Deduction Opportunity
insights.description: Your business travel expenses suggest significant vehicle usage. Tracking mileage could result in a deduction of $3,200 based on the standard mileage rate. Consider using mileage tracking for future trips.

insights.title: Dining Expense Trend Increase
insights.description: Your dining expenses have increased by 34% this month compared to your 3-month average. This is $420 over your typical spending pattern.

insights.title: Detected Pattern: Uber Transactions
insights.description: I've identified recurring Uber charges. Should I automatically categorize these as 'Transportation' for business travel?

insights.title: R&D Tax Credit Eligible
insights.description: Your software development expenses qualify for the Research & Development Tax Credit. Based on your payroll and project costs, you could claim up to $8,500.

insights.title: Duplicate Payment Detected
insights.description: You may have paid the same invoice twice. Two payments of $450 were made to the same vendor within 3 days. Review these transactions to request a refund if needed.

insights.title: Professional Development Deduction
insights.description: Your education and training expenses qualify as professional development deductions. This includes online courses, certifications, and conference fees totaling $890.

insights.title: Unused Subscription: Adobe Creative Cloud
insights.description: You haven't used Adobe Creative Cloud in the past 60 days, but you're still being charged $54.99/month. Consider canceling to save $660 annually.

insights.title: Detected Pattern: Starbucks Purchases
insights.description: I've noticed frequent Starbucks transactions. Should I automatically categorize these as 'Meals & Entertainment'?

rules.name: AWS Charges → Software & Tools
rules.description: Automatically categorize transactions from Amazon Web Services as 'Software & Tools'

rules.name: GitHub Subscription → Software & Tools
rules.description: Automatically categorize GitHub subscription charges as 'Software & Tools'

rules.name: Starbucks → Meals & Entertainment
rules.description: Automatically categorize Starbucks purchases as 'Meals & Entertainment'

rules.name: Office Depot → Office Supplies
rules.description: Automatically categorize Office Depot purchases as 'Office Supplies'

rules.name: Delta Airlines → Travel
rules.description: Automatically categorize Delta Airlines charges as 'Travel'
